etymologies: late Middle English (as a noun): from French section or Latin sectio(n-), from secare ‘to cut’. The verb dates from the early 19th century

definitions: any of the more or less distinct parts into which something is or may be divided or from which it is made up

examples.text: arrange orange sections on a platter

shortDefinitions: any of more or less distinct parts into which something is or may be divided or from which it is made up

definitions: a relatively distinct part of a book, newspaper, statute, or other document

examples.text: the New York Times business section
this last section of the questionnaire relates solely to training

shortDefinitions: relatively distinct part of document

definitions: a measure of land, equal to one square mile.
shortDefinitions: measure of land, equal to one square mile

definitions: a particular district of a town

examples.text: a residential section of the capital

shortDefinitions: particular district of town

definitions: a distinct group within a larger body of people or things

examples.text: the children's section of the library

shortDefinitions: distinct group within larger body of people or things

definitions: a group of players of a family of instruments within an orchestra
shortDefinitions: group of players of family of instruments within orchestra

definitions: a small class of students who are part of a larger course but are taught separately

examples.text: graduate students lead discussion sections for professors' lecture courses

shortDefinitions: small class of students who are part of larger course but are taught separately

definitions: a specified military unit

examples.text: a camouflage section was added to the army

shortDefinitions: specified military unit

definitions: a subdivision of an army platoon.
shortDefinitions: subdivision of army platoon

definitions: a secondary taxonomic category, especially a subgenus.
shortDefinitions: secondary taxonomic category

definitions: the cutting of a solid by or along a plane.
shortDefinitions: cutting of solid by or along plane

definitions: the shape resulting from cutting a solid along a plane
shortDefinitions: shape resulting from cutting solid along plane

definitions: a representation of the internal structure of something as if it has been cut through vertically or horizontally

examples.text: a section of face, showing the position of the organs of speech

shortDefinitions: representation of internal structure of something as if it has been cut through vertically or horizontally

definitions: a separation by cutting.
shortDefinitions: separation by cutting

definitions: a thin slice of plant or animal tissue prepared for microscopic examination.
shortDefinitions: thin slice of plant or animal tissue prepared for microscopic examination

definitions: divide into sections

examples.text: she began to section the grapefruit

shortDefinitions: divide into sections

definitions: separate an area from a larger one

examples.text: parts of the curved balcony had been sectioned off with wrought-iron grilles

shortDefinitions: separate area from larger one

definitions: cut (animal or plant tissue) into thin slices for microscopic examination

examples.text: the specimens were embedded and serially sectioned

shortDefinitions: cut animal or plant tissue into thin slices for microscopic examination

definitions: divide by cutting

examples.text: it is common veterinary practice to section the nerves to the hoof of a limping horse

shortDefinitions: divide by cutting

definitions: commit (someone) compulsorily to a psychiatric hospital in accordance with a section of a mental health act
shortDefinitions: commit someone compulsorily to psychiatric hospital in accordance with section of mental health act
